intro: Hebeclinium tepicanum, commonly known as the Chilean hebe, is a flowering plant native to southern Chile. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or coastal landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is a popular choice for gardeners in temperate climates.
